column4: OK, in Nautilus, disk-3 is my boot partition, how do I find out what it's /dev/sdx is?
Now how do I fix the grub that is on /dev/hda3?
u mean the grub is broken?
how come it broke? can u tell
I installed a new version of Ubuntu (64bit)
I think that is the problem.
maybe it is not mounting as /boot or something
if I change the flag to boot in gparted will that fix it?
so you're using a live cd to inspect the drive. well, you can boot with the cd and enter rescue mode, from it, you can try grub-install /dev/sda
